author: potuz
content: <@144468805697929216> I started playing with ethdo to submit BLSToExecutionChanges (thanks a lot that tool is awesome). I noticed that ethdo is happy to send these changes before Capella hits. In fact I managed to bork my own interop by not validating the fork with the signature and inserting the BLS change in the pool before capella started, so as soon as Capella hit I was submitting BLS changes with old signatures that couldn't be verified. üôÇ

author: jgm
content: Yeah I left it like that for now. Need to discuss what should happen in this situation: should ethdo not send, or should it assume the beacon nodes will either reject or queue to incorporate once the fork activates? It's easy enough to carry out a check before sending from my side, but if beacon nodes are able to queue the credential change requests it could disadvantage those trying to get ahead with their change ops.
